pe_description: The Basic Materials sub-sector in Indonesia has a P/E ratio of 7.88, lower than the average IDX P/E ratio. Its P/E ratio has declined compared to last year, ranking 12th among sub-sectors in the Indonesian market. Within the sub-sector, 16 companies outperform the average P/E ratio, with '###PT SLJ Global Tbk####', '###Ancora Indonesia Resources Tbk####', and '###Bintang Mitra Semestaraya Tbk####' being the most undervalued. On the other hand, '###Barito Pacific Tbk####' is considered overvalued and should be avoided. Factors influencing growth in this sub-sector include government policies, global demand for commodities, and technological advancements in the industry.
health_description: The Basic Materials sub-sector in Indonesia, comprising 105 companies, has exhibited a lackluster performance in the past 30 days, ranking 21st among sub-sectors based on price changes. Its average price changes have lagged behind the IDX index. The sub-sector's resilience and health index can be influenced by factors such as government regulations, supply and demand dynamics, technological advancements, and global economic conditions. The Indonesian government, through relevant ministries and agencies, plays a crucial role in shaping the regulatory landscape for the Basic Materials sub-sector, which can have a significant impact on its resilience and overall health.
growth_description: The Basic Materials sub-sector in Indonesia experienced a -33.59% average YoY quarter earnings change and a 14.15% average YoY quarter revenue change. ###Central Omega Resources Tbk#### recorded the highest YoY earnings growth, ###Bumi Resources Minerals Tbk#### had the highest YoY revenue growth, and ###Bumi Resources Minerals Tbk#### also had the highest net profit margin. The growth of this sub-sector can be affected by conditions such as changes in commodity prices, fluctuations in demand and supply, government regulations specifically related to the Basic Materials industry, and global economic conditions.
